isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CLUTCH CONTROL LINKAGE - 9800 SERIES - MAINTENANCE - INSPECTION

svcproc.title: INSPECTION
svcproc.para: At the time of vehicle chassis lubrication, check the clutch pedal free travel. If free travel is less than 1.7" (43 mm), make necessary adjustments.

At least once each year and in the event of clutch service, inspect clutch control linkage for worn or damaged parts. Worn yoke pins and yoke pin holes in control rods and levers could affect linkage adjustment and clutch operation. Replace any worn or damaged parts. When installing new parts, the clutch linkage should be lubricated and re-adjusted.
